update.description:
I ported a few fixes from pull request #81

- used new ray projection API 

- removed material ambient component

- add `Object3D.getDescendants()` in `three.compat.js` for backward compatibility

Here are some of the new changes I had to make:

- fixed grid rendering

- fixed sprites in radial menu for gzweb mobile

- fixed incorrect joint visuals axis offset 

- fixed bounding box geom

- fixed transform control mouse picking (ray intersection no longer works with invisible obj, so used invisible material instead)

- updated collada loader and tweaked texture loading.

- updated collada loader to use normal map by default if bumptype not specified

- mixed ambient with diffuse for a consistent look with gazebo. 

- fixed submesh loading

Known Issue

- Some collada mesh's surface normals appear to be flipped, e.g. `house_3`. The problem could be the mesh itself - more specifically, the fault of collada exporters from 3d modeling tools. I imported and exported some of the meshes using a more recent version of blender and the models rendered correctly. I'll submit PRs to gazebo_models to fix these meshes.
update.title: Threejs r86

content.raw: Actually, it does register the right-click and goes back to "View mode", the problem seems to be with interactions that look for a ray intersection
content.html: Actually, it does register the right-click and goes back to "View mode", the problem seems to be with interactions that look for a ray intersection

content.raw: Not sure exactly how to reproduce it, but after inserting a couple of models, the 3D scene stopped receiving mouse events completely, no clicks or scrolls
content.html: Not sure exactly how to reproduce it, but after inserting a couple of models, the 3D scene stopped receiving mouse events completely, no clicks or scrolls

content.raw: Btw, this issue has been fixed: https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo/issues/1268
content.html: Btw, this issue has been fixed: https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo/issues/1268

content.html: ticketed issue #99

content.raw:
see previous comment. Will look into integrating ColladaLoader2.js

Also I notice I have problem opening your links.  For example the one here takes me to an URL that's invalid:

#!/osrf/gzweb/src/542043bc4e5e95497b284bdeb7053ac9dfb9158a/Link%20https:/github.com/mrdoob/three.js/issues/10931

Did you use the markdown syntax?

~~~
[link name](link_url)
~~~
content.html:
see previous comment. Will look into integrating ColladaLoader2.js

Also I notice I have problem opening your links. For example the one here takes me to an URL that's invalid:

#!/osrf/gzweb/src/542043bc4e5e95497b284bdeb7053ac9dfb9158a/Link%20https:/github.com/mrdoob/three.js/issues/10931

Did you use the markdown syntax?

[link name](link_url)

content.raw:
Added check for multi-material and material arrays in 64e6026.  The ISS wireframe view should render correctly now.

just found about about this [threejs issue](https://github.com/mrdoob/three.js/issues/11760) that ColladaLoader.js may be removed in favor of ColladaLoader2.js. So I think I won't spend time fixing this. I'll wait for the next ColladaLoader2 release and integrate that.
content.html:
Added check for multi-material and material arrays in 64e6026. The ISS wireframe view should render correctly now.

just found about about this threejs issue that ColladaLoader.js may be removed in favor of ColladaLoader2.js. So I think I won't spend time fixing this. I'll wait for the next ColladaLoader2 release and integrate that.

content.raw: Yes, the weird initial pose happen when inserting models with a mouse.
content.html: Yes, the weird initial pose happen when inserting models with a mouse.

content.raw:
great thanks, I see you started ticketing issues. 

For this PR, I'll focus on new issues that are not already in the `default` branch but I'll leave the warnings on image size as is for now. Regard 2 - weird initial pose happen, that's when inserting models with a mouse?
content.html:
great thanks, I see you started ticketing issues.

For this PR, I'll focus on new issues that are not already in the default branch but I'll leave the warnings on image size as is for now. Regard 2 - weird initial pose happen, that's when inserting models with a mouse?

content.raw: A lot of the problems That I'm having are common with the default branch, but since we most likely to continue working from this branch I guess I should list them: 1- Adding a book shelf I get a warning ```THREE.WebGLRenderer: image is not power of two (496x329). Resized to 512x256 ​``` and the book shelf doesn't appear after about 30 seconds the book shelf does appear. 2- gzweb weird initial poses: Fast food model initial pose is under the ground while some are on the ground, some are flying, I tried adding the same models from Gzclient and their initial poses were correct [all on the ground].
content.html:
A lot of the problems That I'm having are common with the default branch, but since we most likely to continue working from this branch I guess I should list them: 1- Adding a book shelf I get a warning THREE.WebGLRenderer: image is not power of two (496x329). Resized to 512x256 <img src=​"assets/​media/​materials/​textures/​wood.png">​ and the book shelf doesn't appear after about 30 seconds the book shelf does appear.

2- gzweb weird initial poses: Fast food model initial pose is under the ground while some are on the ground, some are flying, I tried adding the same models from Gzclient and their initial poses were correct [all on the ground].

content.raw:
considering the removal if ```MultiMaterial``` Warning this would be ```descendants[i].materials.length``` instead of ```descendants[i].material.materials.length```
have a look @ my comment on ```ColladaLoader.js``` @ line 1187
content.html: considering the removal if MultiMaterial Warning this would be descendants[i].materials.length instead of descendants[i].material.materials.length have a look @ my comment on ColladaLoader.js @ line 1187
